intro: Allochrusa transhyrcana, commonly known as the Trans-Iranian sand lily, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it plays a role in stabilizing desert ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
